page.title: 04The Knights of St. John
page.content: Torphichen has ancient links with the hospitaller Knights of St. John. The preceptory, parts of which still stand today, was the headquarters of the Knights of St. John in the 12th. century. The order of the Knights of St. John is still in operation today. The members raise money for many different types of charities. In Lothian Region they raise money for an old folks home, in Central Region they raise money for a home for the blind and in Grampian they raise money for the mountain rescue team. The Order of St. John is open to anyone and nine people in the village who are members take part in fund raising events. The minister of Torphichen is a Chaplain in the Order of St.John and he conducts a service each year in the Preceptory on the Sunday nearest St. John's Day, the 24th. June.
